message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY

This paper describes a system for fact verification and evidence retrieval using natural language processing techniques. The approach involves identifying relevant Wikipedia documents based on TFIDF vector similarity and named entity recognition, and then using a textual entailment recognition module to assess the veracity of the claim. This involves calculating probabilities for each sentence in the documents, which are used as features for a Random Forest classifier. Based on this description, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are computational linguistics (cs.CL), information retrieval (cs.IR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and cybernetics (cs.CY).
